source.name: NJ Division of Taxation – MOD IV Average Residential Tax Report

paragraphs: Atlantic County's property tax landscape reflects its mix of coastal communities, suburban areas, and rural towns, each with distinct tax rates based on local service needs.
The NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 Average Residential Tax Report shows Atlantic County's average residential tax bill at approximately $6,799.

Whether you're budgeting for a primary residence or evaluating investment properties, this calculator helps you estimate annual and monthly tax obligations across different Atlantic County municipalities.
Municipal selection can significantly refine your estimate, as neighboring towns often have different rates due to varying school district funding and local service levels.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Bergen County is consistently one of the highest-tax areas in New Jersey, and tax bills can vary widely by municipality even for similarly priced homes.
Use this page to estimate annual and monthly property tax costs for planning and comparison. Enter your property value and select your municipality if known to refine the estimate.
According to the NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 Average Residential Tax Report, the average residential tax bill in Bergen County was about $13,600.
This calculator is best used for planning and comparison: try different home values, and (if available in your dataset) select a town to see how the estimate changes.
copy.disclaimer: This tool provides estimates, not official tax bills. Always verify with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Homeowners in Burlington County benefit from a range of suburban communities, but property tax rates can differ meaningfully between municipalities.
Based on 2024 data from the NJ Division of Taxation, the average residential property tax bill in Burlington County came to $7,786.
This planning tool lets you explore how different property values and municipal selections affect your estimated tax burden in Burlington County.
When comparing homes in different Burlington towns, remember that even similar property values can yield different tax bills due to local rate variations.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Camden County encompasses diverse communities from urban centers to suburban neighborhoods, each with its own property tax structure.
The 2024 Average Residential Tax Report from the NJ Division of Taxation indicates Camden County's average residential tax bill was around $7,468.
Use the calculator to model different property values and see how municipal selection impacts your estimated annual and monthly tax payments.
Understanding these estimates helps with financial planning, whether you're buying, refinancing, or simply reviewing your housing costs in Camden County.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Cape May County's property tax rates reflect its unique character as a coastal destination, with seasonal and year-round communities each setting rates based on local needs.
Per the NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 report, Cape May County had an average residential tax bill of $6,273, making it one of the more affordable counties in New Jersey.
This estimation tool is particularly useful for comparing seasonal versus year-round property ownership costs, or evaluating different Cape May municipalities.
Enter your property value below and, if you know your municipality, select it to get a more precise estimate of your annual and monthly tax obligations.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Cumberland County offers some of New Jersey's most affordable property tax rates, though individual municipalities still show meaningful variation.
The NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 data shows Cumberland County with the lowest average residential tax bill statewide at $4,832.
This calculator helps you understand how property taxes factor into your total housing costs in Cumberland County, whether you're planning a purchase or reviewing current expenses.
Municipal selection matters here too—even within this lower-tax county, choosing a specific town can refine your estimate for more accurate budgeting.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Essex County property taxes vary significantly by municipality, driven by differences in local budgets and school tax contributions.
If you're comparing homes across Essex towns, a consistent estimation tool can make "true monthly cost" easier to evaluate.

According to the NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 Average Residential Tax Report, Essex County's average residential tax bill was approximately $13,615, making it one of the highest-tax counties in New Jersey.

Use the calculator below to estimate annual and monthly property taxes using county/town rate assumptions from NJ tax data tables (general and effective tax rate reporting is published by the NJ Division of Taxation).
For best results, select a specific municipality when available—neighboring towns can produce very different estimates even with the same home value.
copy.disclaimer: Estimates only; confirm with local assessor.

paragraphs: Gloucester County's property tax structure balances suburban development with agricultural areas, creating a range of rates across its municipalities.
The 2024 Average Residential Tax Report from the NJ Division of Taxation shows Gloucester County's average residential tax bill at $7,662.
Whether you're evaluating homes in different Gloucester towns or planning your annual budget, this calculator provides quick estimates of annual and monthly tax costs.
Selecting a specific municipality when available will give you a more accurate picture, as local school funding and service levels vary throughout the county.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Hudson County includes a mix of dense cities and smaller municipalities, which can lead to meaningful tax differences within a short distance.
According to the NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 Average Residential Tax Report, the average residential tax bill in Hudson County was about $10,065.
This estimation tool is especially valuable when comparing Hudson County municipalities, as urban centers like Jersey City and Hoboken can have very different tax profiles than smaller towns.
Enter your property value and select your municipality to see how annual and monthly tax estimates vary across Hudson County's diverse communities.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Hunterdon County's rural and suburban communities maintain relatively high property tax rates, reflecting strong school systems and local service levels.
The NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 report indicates Hunterdon County's average residential tax bill reached $11,198, placing it among the higher-tax counties in New Jersey.
This calculator helps you understand how property taxes contribute to your total cost of ownership in Hunterdon County, useful for both buyers and current homeowners reviewing their expenses.
Municipal selection can make a noticeable difference in your estimate, as Hunterdon's towns vary in their tax rates based on local budget priorities.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Mercer County spans from the state capital of Trenton to suburban communities like Princeton and Hamilton, each with distinct property tax characteristics.
Per the 2024 Average Residential Tax Report from the NJ Division of Taxation, Mercer County's average residential tax bill was $9,543.
This estimation tool is helpful when comparing properties across Mercer County's diverse municipalities, where tax rates can vary significantly between urban and suburban areas.
Enter your property value below and select your municipality if known to get a clearer picture of your annual and monthly tax obligations in Mercer County.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Middlesex County's property tax rates reflect its mix of suburban communities, each balancing local services and school funding needs differently.
The NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 data shows Middlesex County with an average residential tax bill of $9,528.
When shopping for homes in Middlesex County, this calculator helps you quickly compare how property taxes affect total monthly costs across different municipalities.
Selecting a specific town refines your estimate, as neighboring Middlesex communities can have meaningfully different rates despite similar property values.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Monmouth County combines coastal communities with inland suburbs, creating a range of property tax rates that reflect local priorities and school quality.
The 2024 Average Residential Tax Report from the NJ Division of Taxation shows Monmouth County's average residential tax bill at $10,930.
This planning tool is particularly useful for comparing beachfront versus inland properties, or evaluating different Monmouth municipalities when house hunting.
Municipal selection makes a real difference here—coastal towns often have different tax structures than inland communities, so selecting your town provides a more accurate estimate.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Morris County is known for strong school systems and quality municipal services, factors that contribute to its above-average property tax rates.
The NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 report indicates Morris County had an average residential tax bill of $11,757, ranking among New Jersey's higher-tax counties.
This calculator helps you understand how property taxes factor into your total housing costs in Morris County, whether you're evaluating a purchase or planning your annual budget.
Different Morris municipalities can show meaningful rate variations, so selecting your specific town when available will give you a more precise estimate of annual and monthly tax obligations.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Ocean County's property tax landscape reflects its mix of beach communities, retirement areas, and suburban developments, each with different service and school funding needs.
The 2024 Average Residential Tax Report from the NJ Division of Taxation shows Ocean County's average residential tax bill at $7,593.
This estimation tool is useful for comparing seasonal versus year-round property costs, or evaluating different Ocean County municipalities when considering a purchase.
Enter your property value and select your municipality if known to see how annual and monthly tax estimates vary across Ocean County's diverse communities.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Passaic County encompasses both urban centers like Paterson and suburban communities, creating a range of property tax rates across its municipalities.
The NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 data shows Passaic County with an average residential tax bill of $11,212, placing it among New Jersey's higher-tax counties.

This calculator helps you understand how property taxes contribute to total housing costs in Passaic County, useful for buyers comparing different municipalities or current homeowners reviewing expenses.
Municipal selection matters here—urban and suburban Passaic communities often have different tax structures, so selecting your specific town provides a more accurate estimate.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Salem County offers some of New Jersey's more affordable property tax rates, with a mix of rural and small-town communities setting rates based on local needs.
The 2024 Average Residential Tax Report from the NJ Division of Taxation shows Salem County's average residential tax bill at $6,706.
This estimation tool helps you understand how property taxes factor into your total cost of ownership in Salem County, whether you're planning a purchase or reviewing current expenses.
While Salem County generally has lower rates, municipal selection can still refine your estimate, as individual towns vary in their tax structures.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Somerset County's property tax rates reflect its reputation for strong schools and quality municipal services, with rates varying across its suburban communities.
The NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 report shows Somerset County with an average residential tax bill of $11,355, ranking among the state's higher-tax counties.
When evaluating homes in Somerset County, this calculator helps you quickly see how property taxes affect total monthly costs, making it easier to compare properties across different municipalities.
Selecting a specific Somerset municipality refines your estimate, as neighboring towns can have meaningfully different rates despite similar property values.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Sussex County's rural and suburban communities maintain property tax rates that balance local services with the county's more affordable cost structure compared to other northern New Jersey counties.
The 2024 Average Residential Tax Report from the NJ Division of Taxation indicates Sussex County's average residential tax bill was $8,640.
This calculator helps you understand how property taxes contribute to your total housing costs in Sussex County, useful for both prospective buyers and current homeowners planning their budgets.
Municipal selection can make a difference in your estimate, as Sussex County's towns vary in their tax rates based on local budget priorities and school funding needs.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Union County has some of New Jersey's highest property tax rates, reflecting strong school systems and comprehensive municipal services across its suburban communities.
The NJ Division of Taxation's 2024 data shows Union County with the highest average residential tax bill statewide at $12,047.
This estimation tool is essential when comparing properties in Union County, as property taxes represent a significant portion of total monthly housing costs here.
Selecting a specific Union County municipality refines your estimate, as rates can vary meaningfully between neighboring towns despite similar property values.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.

paragraphs: Warren County's property tax rates reflect its rural and small-town character, generally offering more affordable rates compared to many other New Jersey counties.
The 2024 Average Residential Tax Report from the NJ Division of Taxation shows Warren County's average residential tax bill at $7,879.
This calculator helps you understand how property taxes factor into your total cost of ownership in Warren County, useful for buyers evaluating homes or current homeowners reviewing expenses.
While Warren County maintains relatively lower rates overall, municipal selection can still refine your estimate, as individual towns vary in their tax structures and service levels.
copy.disclaimer: This page provides estimates for planning and comparison. Actual tax bills vary by municipality and exemptions. Verify details with your local tax assessor.
